article: No One Is Too Poor to Give When Teresa,a widow with four young children,saw a notice from her church for all members to gather to deliver presents and food to a _ family,she took $10 out of her savings jar and bought some ingredients to make three dozen _ .She got to the church parking lot just in time to join the convoy going to the home that was to _ the people's help. The route was _ ,and she was astonished when the cars pulled up in front of her house.When the pastor saw her,he said," We _ expected you to join us , Teresa.We know it's been a great _ since your husband died,and we all wanted to _ you." Although she was _ being the object of charity,Teresa didn't want to _ anyone so she _ said," Well,at least I can share these cookies with our _ ." This parable teaches us that no one is too _ to help others and that true charity is rooted in love and compassion. _ of spirit is worse than economic distress.Teresa's story _ us that very few of us give as much as we could and should. My friend Larry Rosen,president of the YMCA of Metropolitan Los Angeles _ me to the concept of " sacrificial giving"-- _ point where one must _ something that is desired. You can start out easy.Take whatever _ you are thinking of giving to charity,then _ it.If that's too much, increase it by 50 percent instead.The _ is to stretch yourself.It will mean a lot to those you help,but it will mean as much to your heart.
